BIBREF0.title: Comparative analysis of bat genomes provides insight into the 129 evolution of flight and immunity

BIBREF1.title: The effect of Zhangfei on the unfolded protein response 132 and growth of cells derived from canine and human osteosarcomas

BIBREF3.title: RIG-I, MDA5 and TLR3 synergistically play an 135 important role in restriction of dengue virus infection

FIGREF0.text: Big brown bat bone marrow derived myeloid cells were a mixed 22 population. Bone marrow derived cells were deposited on a slide by centrifugation 23 and differentially stained. Various populations of myeloid cells were observed. Cell 24 types based on morphological features are labelled in the figure. Transfection of poly(I:C) is essential to activation of the TLR3 34 pathway. To determine if poly(I:C) is recognized by a cell surface receptor or an 35 internal receptor, such as TLR3, in bat cells, we quantified IFNβ transcripts in Efk3 36 cells after transfecting or adding poly(I:C) to culture medium. Adding poly(I:C) to the 37 culture medium did not upregulate IFNβ transcripts in Efk3 cells, whereas 38 transfecting poly(I:C) induced several thousand folds of IFNβ transcripts (S3. c-Rel siRNA shuts down expression of HA-tagged c-Rel. To study the 50 knockdown potential of c-Rel siRNA at a protein level, we simultaneously transfected 51 HEK293T cells with siRNA specific to c-Rel, non-specific scrambled siRNA (NC 52 siRNA) or no siRNA and plasmids expressing HA-tagged c-Rel. (a) siRNA specific 53 to c-Rel completely shuts down the expression of HA-c-Rel from the plasmid. In 54 contrast, cells transfected with NC siRNA or no siRNA express HA-c-Rel. (b) There 55 was no change in GAPDH expression between different treatments. Mutations in the c-Rel Rel homology domain (RHD). Zhang et al. show 64 that 4 mutations specific to bat c-Rel exist in the downstream region of the RHD 1 . 65 IκB binding domain is located in the downstream region of the RHD and Zhang et al. 66 propose mutations in this region can affect IκB binding. Differences in amino acids 67 between bat RHD domains and those of other representative mammals are 68 S5. qRT-PCR products from ChIP assay were electrophoresed on 81 separate gels. Images for figure 8 in the article file are shown above. Cropped images 82

TABREF0.text: PRR transcripts detected in human (MRC5) and bat (Efk3) 85 Supplemental Table S2. Fold changes observed for innate immune gene transcripts 88 in MRC5 and Efk3 cells after different TLR ligand treatments. We transfected human 89 fibroblasts and bat kidney (Efk3) cells with poly(I:C), a known TLR3 stimulant, and 90 studied the expression of genes involved in the TLR3 pathway, relative to mock 91 transfected cells. Experiments were carried out in replicates (n=3). Standard deviation 92 values are reported along with mean fold changes. 93 temperatures for human and big brown bat genes and primers. 99 Supplemental Table S5. siRNA sequences designed against E. fuscus (big brown 102 bat) TLR3, RIGI and MDA5. r = ribose sugar; BBB = big brown bat. 103

back_matter.text: c-Rel Western Blots: HEK293T cells were seeded at a concentration of 3x 10 5 105 cells/well in six well plates and simultaneously transfected with 100nM of 1:1 106 cocktail of two different siRNA specific to c-Rel (table 1)
